New Records: Caden Dana became the youngest pitcher in Angels history to win his debut, and the first pitcher in his big league debut to go at least six innings and permit two or fewer runs at his age or younger since Jordan Lyles on May 31, 2011.
Key Match Events: Taylor Ward extended his hitting streak to 12 games with a leadoff homer
Anthony Rendon provided the go-ahead hit with a two-run single in the fifth
Luke Raley homered for Seattle to tie the game at 1-1
Caden Dana retired the first five hitters he faced before Raley connected on a fastball down the middle and drove it 433 feet into the left-center stands
Post-Match Reflections: Ron Washington said, "He didn’t let any inning affect however it was going and it shows he has some poise. He proved to himself he can pitch in the big leagues," after Caden Dana's debut win
Caden Dana said, "It’s awesome. That was special. Everyone behind me played well," after the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels rallied for a 3-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners on Sunday
Bryce Miller gave up three runs and four hits in 4 2/3 innings for Seattle
Ben Joyce worked a scoreless ninth for his fourth save
Others: Caden Dana, who led double A with 147 strikeouts, appeared in the MLB Futures Game in July and is considered the Angels’ best pitching prospect
Dana threw 52 of his 95 pitches for strikes
